intro: Relbunium alpicola, commonly known as the alpine relbunium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. This species is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in alpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Relbunium alpicola is typically found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous climates.
